title: Clear Your Web Browser Cache and Cookies on Any Platform

steps.title: Click the three-dot menu in Chrome ⋮.
steps.content: Click the three-dot menu in Chrome ⋮ . You'll see these three vertical dots in the top-right corner of your Chrome browser window. A menu will appear. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Select More tools.
steps.content: Select More tools . This expands another menu. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click Clear browsing data….
steps.content: Click Clear browsing data… . It's on the menu. This opens a window with data-clearing options. [3] X Research source You can also press Ctrl (or "CMD" on Mac) + Shift + Del to clear your browsing data.

steps.title: Select a time range.
steps.content: Select a time range. To clear your entire cache, select All Time . Otherwise, you can choose a different time period from the menu. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Check the boxes next to "cookies" and "cached images" .
steps.content: Check the boxes next to "cookies" and "cached images" . If the box is already checked, you can skip this step. If you only want to clear the cache and not your cookies or browsing history, uncheck both other options before you continue.

steps.title: Click Clear Data.
steps.content: Click Clear Data . This instantly clears your Chrome browser cache. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the three-dot menu in Chrome.
steps.content: Tap the three-dot menu in Chrome. If you're using Chrome on your Android, tap the three vertical dots ⋮ at the top-right. On an iPhone or iPad, tap the three horizontal dots … at the bottom right.

steps.title: Tap History on the menu.
steps.content: Tap History on the menu. If you're using an iPhone or iPad, you may have to swipe across the icons to find this option. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Clear browsing data….
steps.content: Tap Clear browsing data… . It's in the lower-left corner of the screen on an iPhone or iPad and at the top of the screen on an Android. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Select both the "cookies" and "cached images" boxes .
steps.content: Select both the "cookies" and "cached images" boxes . If there's already a checkmark next to this option, you can skip this step. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Clear Browsing Data.
steps.content: Tap Clear Browsing Data . It's at the bottom of the screen

steps.title: Select a time frame.
steps.content: Select a time frame. To clear your whole cache, select All Time . Otherwise, select your preferred time range from the menu. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Clear Data or Clear Browsing Data.
steps.content: Tap Clear Data or Clear Browsing Data . This clears your browser cache for Chrome. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Open Safari's Settings.
steps.content: Open Safari's Settings. To do this, click the Safari menu and select Settings . If you're using an older macOS version, you'll open Preferences instead.

steps.title: Click Privacy.
steps.content: Click Privacy . You'll see this along the top of the window next to Advanced and General .

steps.title: Click Manage Website Data.
steps.content: Click Manage Website Data . It's next to the "Cookies and website data" header. [11] X Research source

steps.title: Select one or multiple sites to clear your cache and cookies for.
steps.content: Select one or multiple sites to clear your cache and cookies for. Check the boxes next to the sites you'll be logged out of.

steps.title: Select Remove all.
steps.content: Select Remove all . Alternatively, you can individually select websites from the list instead of removing your cache and cookies from them all. If prompted, click Remove Now and Done . [12] X Research source

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Settings .
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Settings . To clear your browser cache on Safari, you'll need to clear your entire browsing history and cookies. Start by opening the Settings app from your Home screen or App Library. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Safari.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Safari . It's in the 5th group of settings. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Clear History and Website Data.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Clear History and Website Data . You'll find this blue link near the middle of the page. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Clear History and Data to confirm.
steps.content: Tap Clear History and Data to confirm. Doing so will clear all of your iPhone's Safari data, including the cached files and pages. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Click the three-dot menu in Edge ••• .
steps.content: Click the three-dot menu in Edge ••• . You'll see it at Edge's top-right corner. [17] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . It's on the menu.

steps.title: Click Privacy, search, and services.
steps.content: Click Privacy, search, and services . This is in the left panel. [18] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click Choose what to clear.
steps.content: Click Choose what to clear . This is a button in the right panel next to "Clear browsing data now."

steps.title: Choose a length of time.
steps.content: Choose a length of time. Select how much data to clear from the "Time range" menu at the top. To clear your entire cache, select All time . [19] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Check the box next to "cookies" and "cached images" .
steps.content: Check the box next to "cookies" and "cached images" . Removing this data will log you out of sites and may make your browsing experience slower.

steps.title: Click Clear now.
steps.content: Click Clear now . This deletes your Edge browser cache and cookies. [20] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click the menu in Firefox ☰.
steps.content: Click the menu in Firefox ☰ . It's the three horizontal lines in the top-right corner of the window. [21] X Research source

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . It's toward the bottom of the menu. [22] X Research source

steps.title: Click Privacy & Security.
steps.content: Click Privacy & Security . You'll find this in the left panel. [23] X Research source

steps.title: Click the Clear Data button.
steps.content: Click the Clear Data button. It's under "Cookies and Site Data" in the right panel.

steps.title: Choose what to delete.
steps.content: Choose what to delete. You'll definitely want to check the "Cached Web Content" checkbox as well as the checkbox for cookies, but everything else is optional. [24] X Research source

steps.title: Click Clear.
steps.content: Click Clear . This clears your Firefox browser cache. [25] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the three-dot menu in Firefox.
steps.content: Tap the three-dot menu in Firefox. It's at the top-right corner of your web browser. [26] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Settings on the menu.
steps.content: Tap Settings on the menu. [27] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Delete browsing data.
steps.content: Tap Delete browsing data . [28] X Research source

steps.title: Choose what to delete.
steps.content: Choose what to delete. Make sure you have both the boxes checked for "cache" and "cookies."

steps.title: Tap Delete browsing data.
steps.content: Tap Delete browsing data . A confirmation message will appear. [29] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Delete to confirm.
steps.content: Tap Delete to confirm. Your cache is now removed. [30] X Research source Check out more cache clearing tips from wikiHow users on the “Clearing all cached app data on Android?” forum .

steps.title: Tap the menu in Firefox ☰.
steps.content: Tap the menu in Firefox ☰ . It's the three horizontal lines at the bottom-right corner. [31] X Research source In Firefox for iOS, you can only clear the cache by deleting all of your private browsing data. This means you'll also be deleting any saved cookies and your browsing history.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . [32] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Data Management.
steps.content: Tap Data Management . It's under the "Privacy" header. [33] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Clear Private Data.
steps.content: Tap Clear Private Data . It's at the bottom of the screen. [34] X Research source

steps.title: Tap OK when prompted.
steps.content: Tap OK when prompted. Doing so will clear the cached files from your Firefox browser.

steps.title: Tap the three-line menu in Samsung Internet.
steps.content: Tap the three-line menu in Samsung Internet. You'll see it at the bottom-right corner of your browser. [35] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . It's the gear icon in the menu. [36] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Personal browsing data.
steps.content: Tap Personal browsing data . This option is in the "Privacy" section. [37] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Delete browsing data.
steps.content: Tap Delete browsing data . It's near the top of the page.

steps.title: Select the boxes for "Cached images and files" and "cookies."
steps.content: Select the boxes for "Cached images and files" and "cookies." If you don't want to clear other data, such as your browsing history or cookies, remove the checkmarks from other options.

steps.title: Tap Delete data.
steps.content: Tap Delete data . It's at the bottom of the screen. Your Samsung Internet browser cache is now clear. [38] X Research source
